New Records: Tarik Skubal became the fourth Detroit left-hander with 200 strikeouts in a season.
Key Match Events: Tarik Skubal allowed one run in eight innings and struck out eight.
Tyler O’Neill hit a first-inning homer for Boston.
Spencer Torkelson hit a one-out single and Zach McKinstry extended his hitting streak to a career-best 11 games with a double.
Trey Sweeney hit a fly ball to left that drove in two runs with a double.
Tyler Holton pitched the ninth for his sixth save.
Ryan Kreidler and Parker Meadows were picked off first in the seventh inning.
Kreidler made a jump throw from foul territory behind third to retire Triston Casas in the eighth.
Post-Match Reflections: Tarik Skubal reflected on the significance of pitching deep into the game on the night the Tigers celebrated the 1984 World Series championship.
Tigers manager A.J. Hinch praised Skubal's performance and his potential to win the Cy Young.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora acknowledged Skubal's talent and emphasized the need for Boston to win the series.
Hinch credited third base coach Joey Cora for the aggressive decision to send McKinstry to the plate.
Alex Cora commented on Joey Cora's aggressive coaching style.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers celebrated the franchise's 1984 World Series championship.
Jack Morris threw the ceremonial first pitch to Lance Parrish.
Rich Hill, the only player on either roster born when the Tigers last won the World Series, picked off Parker Meadows.
Others: The teams will finish the three-game series on Sunday with Detroit RHP Ty Madden making his second start against Boston RHP Cooper Criswell.
